snippet.title: My version of the Cinematronics arcade game, Star Castle - Star Citadel - modern game mode
snippet.description:
Star Castle is perhaps one of the lesser known games from the golden era of arcade games. Released by Cinematronics in 1980, it's pretty clearly influenced by games like Asteroids, and the venerable. I'm really surprised it's not better known because it's such an awesome game so, when I found out about it, and found there weren't really any decent versions available on the web, and certainly nothing you could play on your phone or tablet, I decided to create my own.

My version is called Star Citadel and there are two game modes: modern and classic. Here we see the modern variant, which has much more snappy control of the player's ship, akin to Asteroids Deluxe, and (because phones, and because I don't want you to wreck your keyboard by hammering the space bar) features rapid fire when you press and hold SPACE.

TO PLAY VISIT: https://arcade.ly/games/starcastle/

Probably Star Castle's biggest claim to fame is that it was transmogrified into Yars' Revenge on the Atari 2600 console by Howard Scott Warshaw, because he didn't think Star Castle would work well on the 2600. Little did he know - decades later D. Scott Williamson proved him wrong with an excellent 2600 port, funded by Kickstarter.

Check out https://arcade.ly/ for other games, including a sweet version of Asteroids, and my blog (focussed on web performance, development, and gaming) at https://arcade.ly/blog/.

Btw, I haven't tried it on any of the more recent console browsers (PS4, XBox One) but there's a chance (once I've added decent game controller support) it might work.
